doc.after: An important subset of sequential games consists of games of perfect information A game is one of perfect information if all players know the moves previously made by all other players Thus only sequential games can be games of perfect information because players in simultaneous games do not know the actions of the other players Most games studied in game theory are imperfect information games Interesting examples of perfect information games include the ultimatum game and centipede game Recreational games of perfect information games include chess go and mancala Many card games are games of imperfect information such as poker or contract bridge
